page.title: 20Home gadgets, Montrose.
page.content: We live in an age of gadgets. Some help us with daily chores, others make our work easier, while many make life more enjoyable and entertaining. In a survey of parents in the{Borrowfield area of Montrose it was found that 100% of those surveyed owned a television, a vacumn cleaner and a camera.Are these "gadgets" now necessities? More than 75% of parents owned a hair drier, telephone, calculator, stereo hi-fi, or radio or radio/cassette. Between 50% and 75% of people had a freezer, mixer/blender, video, digital clock radio, toaster, tumble drier, personal hi-fi, or home computer. In the <50% category, 11% owned an electric toothbrush while gadgets to help Mum were less common. eg. dish washer 14%, micro wave oven 21%, slow cooker 11%, infra red grill 12%, food processor 27%.
